messages.message:
@Kerry - this is the feedback from the client:                                                           I am using the following app deployment endpoint:
https://${stageVariables.API_ROOT}/v2/*aihub*/deployments/${stageVariables.APP_DEPLOYMENT_PART1}/*run*

I used to pass the batch id has as String
{
    "batch_id":"_{{lastBatchId}}_"
}

Since wednesday, the API calls were returning a cryptic "unknown exception" error

After investigations and tests, I finally noticed that the batchId should now be passed as a number.

This fixed the error.

I also noticed that the API documentation now reference a new, different, endpoint for app deployment runs :
https://${stageVariables.API_ROOT}/v2/*apps*/deployments/${stageVariables.APP_DEPLOYMENT_PART1}/*runs*

This endpoint returns a simple "id" instead of "job_id"
The endpoint I am currently using is not referenced anymore in your API documentation - even in the legacy one.

So to wrap this up it's a bit confusing as this implies:
- breaking change for us since passing the batchId as string is not supported anymore
- implementation changes on the client side to migrate to new endpoint and take "id" instead of "batch_id" as a result
- inability to retrieve the previous API documentation for the run app deployment endpoint I am using

Ok, this is very valuable feedback; thanks for collecting that from the customer.

The `aihub` to `apps` API change was announced here https://docs.instabase.com/release-notes#api--sdk-3 back in 24.36 (Sep 16). Don't think it ever reaches the customer.

Think we need to update our process to announce API deprecations, people apparently don't read it  -- a common practice is supporting the older format for a month or two while proactively sending emails to the customers still using the endpoint to ask them to change before a certain date. At a certain date, we will delete that API. We also need to prioritize some resources to improve the metrics side of this to track / delete legacy APIs efficiently. cc @hannah @Ram Prasanna I'll work with you on the process.

Meanwhile @Anil @Abhishek Adupa can you still run a retro on how / if the batch_id param stops supporting strings in this release -- I know we think (and user reported) it was never supported, but according to this somehow it did and the behavior changed. Let's at least do our sanity check; meanwhile there're clear next steps.
